intro: Phacelia curvipes var. macrantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators make it a desirable plant for native gardens.
